channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Interview Advice: Being interesting can be more important than just being right
item.description: When youâ€™re being asked technical questions, the point is not seeing whether or not you know the right answer â€” the point is to get you to show off your technical skills. Thereâ€™s overlap there, but those are not the same thing.

item.title: Dreaming of Perl? Mid/Senior-level developer role in The City of Dreaming Spires
item.description: The Victorian poet Matthew Arnold called Oxford â€˜the city of dreaming spiresâ€™, and even the most unromantic among us would surely agree there is something magical about Oxford on a misty autumnal morning.

item.title: Perl Mongers of Wimbledon Common Are We - Perl Developer wanted in Wimbledon
item.description: Back in the day, the Wombles of Wimbledon collected rubbish. Nowadays, since the advent of motorised road sweepers, theyâ€™d be in need of a new profession. Perl Developer, perhaps? Our client is based in the heart of Wimbledon, under a mile away from the Common where the Wombles famously made their home.

item.title: Fixing test failure on Windows - Properly quoting regexes - Accepting GitHub pull request
Marpa for building parsers - a first look
History of the browser user-agent string
item.description: The "User-Agent string" is how browsers identify themselves to web sites. If you've ever written a parser for these, you'll get why I included it. If you haven't, you'll probably just think "huh, so what?".

item.title: The Absurdly Underestimated Dangers of CSV Injection
item.description: You might have come across this already, but if you haven't, then you should read it. If a CSV has a cell starting with =, then when you open the CSV in Excel, the formula will be evaluated. And depending what's in the formula, that could be bad.

item.title: Perl turns 30 and its community continues to thrive
item.description: To mark 30 years of Perl, Ruth wrote a brief history of Perl, and an introduction to some of the Perl communities.

item.title: Dancer 2017 Survey: Update
item.description: Jason gives an update on the Dancer 2017 Survey, and encourages you to contribute, if you haven't already.

item.title: 6lang Naming Proposal is Good
item.description: This month's name for Perl 6 is 6lang. Kimoto-san explains why he likes this, which really comes down to the fact that including "Perl" in the name of "Perl 6" continues to damage both Perl 5 and Perl 6.

item.title: Perl 6 at the London Perl Workshop
item.description: The London Perl Workshop is on Saturday 25th November in central London, and is free to attend. This post gives a taster of some of the Rakudo talks that will be there.

item.title: Rakudo Weekly
item.description: The weekly roundup of Rakudo, or 6lang, news.

item.title: Announcing meta::hack v2
item.description: Last year the MetaCPAN team held meta::hack, a hackathon where they worked on MetaCPAN. You can read about it in Olaf's summary. That was so successful that they've decided to have another one this year. The core MetaCPAN team will be meeting up in Chicago for four days of intensive work on MetaCPAN and friends. They're still looking for sponsorship; this would be a great way for companies to support the Perl community.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: October 2nd to 9th
item.description: They say that Winter is Coming, but not if P5P have anything to do with it!

item.title: Creating Perl5 Objects with Moxie
item.description: Tom shows how he created a class for playing cards, using Moxie, which is Stevan Little's latest OO framework for Perl 5. This article follows another, where he introduces Moxie.

item.title: Tracing Perl memory leaks with Devel::MAT, part 1
item.description: An introduction to using Devel::MAT to find memory leaks in your Perl code.

item.title: An early start on October's pull request challenge
item.description: The CV-Library team are taking part in the pull-request challenge, and normally they get together one night in the month, and have a big team session where they do it all. This month they were assigned Test2-Suite, so Colin decided to get a head-start.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #325 - 30 years of Perl
item.description:
This year marks 30 years of Perl, so Ruth's article is probably not going to be the last one to mark that milestone.

The MetaCPAN project is having another hackathon, and they're looking for sponsors.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
